meanings.definition: A fine-grained, translucent form of gypsum, typically white, often carved into ornaments.
meanings.sent1: The alabasters gleamed in the sunlight, revealing intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: She collected delicate alabasters from different parts of the world.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the alabasters, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for sculpting alabasters into lifelike figures amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient alabasters that told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: A container for holding perfumes or ointments, typically made of alabaster.
meanings.sent1: The alabasters on her vanity held her favorite scents.
meanings.sent2: He gifted her a beautiful alabaster to store her perfumes.
meanings.sent3: The alabasters on the dresser made the room smell delightful.
meanings.sent4: The alabasters on the shelf added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: She carefully arranged her alabasters, each containing a different fragrance.

meanings.sent1: The sunrise painted the sky in soft alabasters and oranges.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was a lovely shade of alabasters, perfect for the occasion.
meanings.sent3: The artist mixed white and pink to create a beautiful alabasters hue.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden bloomed in various shades of alabasters.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in calming alabasters tones, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
